page.title: 03WHITTONSTALL SWORDSTONE
page.content: WHILST UNDERTAKING THE DOMESDAY PROJECT CHILDREN FROM THE SCHOOL {"REDISCOVERED"A VERY OLD GRAVESTONE IN HE CHURCHYARD KNOWN AS A {SWORDSTONE. THIS STONE,1.47mLONG ,IS COPED WITH A FLAT CENTRAL PANEL BEARING AN INCISED SWORD WITH A CIRCULAR POMMEL OF EARLY MEDIEVAL FORM.THE SWORD WITH OR WITHOUT A CROSS IS THE MOST COMMON EMBLEM TO OCCUR ON MEDIEVAL STONES IN THE NORTH OF ENGLAND AND DENOTES THE BURIAL OF A MAN,FEMALE SYMBOLS BEING SHEARS AND/OR A KEY.THE SWORD REPRESENTS THE RIGHT TO BEAR ARMS AND AS ONLY THE UPPER RANKS OF MEDIEVAL SOCIETY COULD AFFORD A MEMORIAL SUCH AS THIS IT IS PROBABLY THE GRAVE OF A MEMBER OF THE BALLIOL FAMILY WHO OBTAINED THE MANOR OF WHITTONSTALL AND NEWLANDS AS REWARD FOR SERVICES RENDERED DURING THE NORMAN CONQUEST.
